notes_display: In Historical Sketches of the Paper Currency of the American Colonies by Henry Phillips, Jr. (1865). Given to Dr. Jesse C. Green in 1890. Leaf 56AB.
issue_place_s: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States of America
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: THIS Indented BILL of FIFTEEN SHILLINGS, shall entitle the Bearer to receive of the Provincial Treasurer, the like Sum of Fifteen Shillings, of equal Value with the same Sum, of the
issue_obverse_legend_s: Bills of Credit now by Law current, according to the Directions of an Act of General Assembly of Pennsilvania, made in the 11th Year of the Reign of HIS MAJESTY George III. Dated March 20, 1771.
issue_reverse_legend_s: FIFTEEN SHILLINGS. | To Counterfeit, is DEATH. | Printed by D. HALL, and W. SELLERS. 1771.
